guide_fas_desc: Set up TapAlert for a senior using Magic Link ‚Äî zero typing required for the senior.
fas_intro_p: This guide is for family members, caregivers, and anyone helping a senior or less tech-savvy person get TapAlert fully configured. Using the Magic Link feature, you can set up the entire app from your own device and deliver a ready-to-use configuration to the senior with a single tap.
fas_overview_p1: The Magic Link feature lets a tech-savvy person ("the admin") do all the configuration work, then share it as a special link. When the senior taps that link on their phone, TapAlert automatically applies the full configuration ‚Äî contacts, messages, settings, and everything ‚Äî in one step.
fas_overview_p2: The senior never needs to type anything or navigate any settings.
fas_before_h2: Before You Begin: What You'll Need

fas_always_li1: The senior's first name (used to personalize alert messages)

fas_twilio_req_li2: Twilio Account SID (from the Twilio Console dashboard)
fas_twilio_req_li3: Twilio Auth Token (from the Twilio Console dashboard)

fas_twilio_req_li5: Your own phone number ‚Äî the app will send a test SMS to verify Twilio works
fas_ios_note: Note for iOS users: On iPhone, automated SMS requires Twilio. Without it, the app opens the native Messages app and the senior taps Send manually. This is still reliable but requires one extra tap.
fas_email_req_p: If you want alerts sent as emails in addition to SMS:
fas_email_req_li1: A dedicated email address to send from (Gmail, Outlook, iCloud, Yahoo, or custom)
fas_email_req_li2: An App Password for that account (see Step 4 below)

fas_s1_p2: The Admin Setup screen will open. Scroll through the sections ‚Äî you'll fill each one in the steps below.

fas_s2_li1: Senior's Name ‚Äî Type the senior's first name (e.g., "Maria"). This name appears in alert messages so recipients know who sent the alert.
fas_s2_tip: Example: If you type "Maria", recipients will receive: "ALERT from Maria: I need help. Location: ‚Ä¶"

fas_s3_optA_li2: On iPhone, the app opens the Messages app pre-filled, and the senior taps Send once. Simple but requires one extra step.

fas_s8_li1: Scroll to the bottom of the screen.

fas_ts1_h3: "Validation failed" error when generating the link
fas_ts1_li1: Check that all required fields are filled in (marked with a red error message).
fas_ts1_li2: If Twilio is enabled, make sure Account SID, Auth Token, and phone number are correct.
fas_ts1_li3: If email is enabled, verify the App Password ‚Äî regular account passwords will not work.
fas_ts2_h3: The senior didn't receive the test SMS
fas_ts2_li1: Verify the Twilio phone number is active and not a trial number sending to unverified numbers.
fas_ts2_li2: In Twilio's free trial, you can only send to phone numbers you've verified in the Twilio Console. Add the senior's contacts as verified numbers, or upgrade to a paid account.
fas_ts2_li3: Check that the phone number format is correct (country code included).
fas_ts3_h3: The Magic Link doesn't open TapAlert
fas_ts3_li1: Make sure TapAlert is installed on the senior's phone.
fas_ts3_li2: On some Android phones, tap-and-hold the link and choose "Open with TapAlert" instead of a browser.
fas_ts3_li3: If a browser opens instead, copy the full URL and paste it into the browser again ‚Äî on the second try, the system usually offers TapAlert as an option.
fas_ts4_h3: The senior accidentally taps the wrong button
fas_ts4_li1: Increase the Alert Countdown to 10‚Äì15 seconds ‚Äî this gives time to cancel before sending.
fas_ts4_li2: Or switch to Hold mode (activation mode = hold) so the button requires a deliberate press-and-hold.
fas_ts4_li3: You can update these settings by generating a new Magic Link with corrected settings and sending it to the senior's phone.
fas_ts5_h3: Twilio SMS works but email doesn't
fas_ts5_li1: Most common cause: recipients don't have email addresses saved. Check recipients in the app's Recipients screen.
fas_ts5_li2: Make sure the App Password is correct and hasn't expired. App Passwords from Gmail and Outlook can be revoked ‚Äî generate a new one if needed.
fas_sec_li1: The Magic Link payload is encoded but not encrypted. Anyone who intercepts it can read the configuration, including Twilio credentials. Share it only directly to the senior.
fas_sec_li2: TapAlert has no servers ‚Äî the Magic Link is processed entirely on the senior's device. No data is sent to the TapAlert service.
fas_sec_li3: Twilio credentials in the link are stored locally on the senior's device in secure (encrypted) storage once applied.
fas_sec_li4: If you believe a Magic Link has been intercepted, rotate your Twilio Auth Token in the Twilio Console immediately and generate a new Magic Link.

ag_meta: TapAlert is designed to be usable by everyone, including people with hearing loss, low vision, tremors, or other age-related conditions. This guide explains each accessibility feature and how to get the most out of it.
ag_step1_who: People with low vision or difficulty reading small text.
ag_step1_p1: TapAlert respects the font size you set in your phone's system settings. If you increase the text size in Settings > Display > Font Size (Android) or Settings > Accessibility > Display & Text Size > Larger Text (iOS), all text in TapAlert will grow accordingly ‚Äî buttons, labels, menus, and messages.
ag_step1_alert_h: No action needed inside the app
ag_step1_alert_p: Just set your preferred font size in your phone settings and TapAlert will follow it automatically.
ag_step2_who: People with severe vision impairment who use a screen reader.
ag_step2_p2: When a screen reader is active:
ag_step2_li3: The SOS and I'm OK buttons are announced with their names and current state (enabled or disabled).
ag_step2_li4: When you start a countdown before sending an alert, the screen reader counts down the remaining seconds aloud so you always know how long you have before the alert is sent.
ag_step2_li5: After an alert is sent, the screen reader announces "Alert sent" or "Alert failed" so you know the outcome without needing to look at the screen.
ag_step3_who: People with hearing loss who cannot hear the countdown sound, or anyone who prefers tactile confirmation.
ag_step3_p1: TapAlert uses your phone's vibration motor to give you physical feedback at key moments:
ag_step3_tr1_2: One firm pulse per second ‚Äî you can feel the countdown in your hand
ag_step3_tr2_2: Three strong pulses in quick succession
ag_step3_tr4_2: Two medium pulses ‚Äî confirms you cancelled, not sent
ag_step3_alert_p: Haptic feedback works automatically as long as vibration is enabled on your phone (check your phone's silent/vibration switch).
ag_step4_who: People who need to hear when an alert is sent, including those with moderate hearing loss.
ag_step4_p1: When an alert is sent, TapAlert plays a sound on your own device to confirm the alert went out. You can customize the sound in Settings > Notification Sound:
ag_step4_li2: Plain Sounds ‚Äî simple, clear tones (good for most users)
ag_step4_p2: Within each sound style, you can also adjust:
ag_step4_li4: Sound Pitch ‚Äî slide left for a lower, deeper tone. Lower-pitched sounds (around 500 Hz) are easier to hear for people with age-related high-frequency hearing loss. The default is already set to a lower pitch for this reason.
ag_step4_li5: Volume ‚Äî set how loud the confirmation sound plays.
ag_step5_who: People with hearing loss who may miss the sound, or anyone in a loud environment. Also useful when the phone is face-down or in a pocket.
ag_step5_p1: When an alert is sent successfully, TapAlert produces:
ag_step5_li1: Screen flash ‚Äî the entire screen lights up white three times in quick succession.
ag_step5_li2: Torch flash ‚Äî the camera LED on the back of the phone flashes three times simultaneously, visible even when the screen faces down.
ag_step5_p2: Both flashes run at the same time and complete in under one second.
ag_step5_alert_p: If you have a photosensitive condition, go to Settings ‚Üí Notification Sound ‚Üí Flash on Alert and switch it off.
ag_step6_who: Anyone who accidentally starts a countdown and needs to cancel it quickly.
ag_step6_p1: When you tap the SOS button, a countdown dialog appears before the alert is sent. You can cancel it in two ways:
ag_step6_li1: Tap the Cancel button at the bottom of the dialog.
ag_step6_li2: Swipe the dialog left or right ‚Äî the dialog slides with your finger and dismisses when you release it far enough.
ag_step6_p2: Either way, you will feel two short vibrations confirming the alert was cancelled and nothing was sent.
ag_step7_who: People with tremors, arthritis, or other conditions that make typing difficult.
ag_step7_p1: Instead of typing a custom message before sending an alert, you can speak it. Tap the microphone icon in the message field and speak your message. The app will transcribe your words automatically. Silence for 3 seconds stops recording.
ag_step7_p2: This works on the home screen message input and in the dead man's timer dialog.
ag_step8_who: People who are prone to accidentally tapping the SOS button.
ag_step8_p1: By default, the SOS button requires only a single tap. If accidental presses are a concern, you can switch to Hold to Send mode:
ag_step8_p2: Go to Settings ‚Üí Trigger Method ‚Üí Hold to Send.
ag_step8_p3: In this mode, you must press and hold the button for the full hold duration before the alert is triggered, preventing accidental sends.
ag_step9_who: Anyone who finds it difficult to unlock their phone and open the app in an emergency.
ag_step9_p1: On Android, you can add a TapAlert widget to your home screen so the SOS button is always one tap away ‚Äî without opening the app at all.
ag_step9_p2: To add the widget: Settings ‚Üí Home Screen Widget ‚Üí Add Widget.

er_p_why_1: Email redundancy is a crucial backup system.
er_why_li1: Zero Cellular Signal: If you are deep inside a building or in a remote area with Wi-Fi but absolutely no cellular coverage, standard SMS and Twilio SMS might fail.
er_why_li2: International Travel: When traveling abroad without a roaming plan, SMS might be disabled, but hotel/cafe Wi-Fi can still send your alert.
er_why_li3: Carrier Outages: Protects against rare but possible cellular network outages.
er_p_why_2: How it works: First, the app attempts to send via Direct SMS or Twilio. If the device detects that these cellular methods have failed (or are impossible due to no signal), it will automatically attempt to send your alert via email.
er_p_how_1: Email redundancy uses your existing email account (Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo, iCloud, etc.) to send the message. This requires SMTP settings.
er_important_p: For security reasons, practically all major email providers now require you to use an App Password rather than your standard email password. An App Password is a unique 16-character code that allows a specific app (like TapAlert) to send email without needing your main password or bypassing Two-Factor Authentication (2FA).

privacy_p1: This {{ footer_privacy }} describes how TapAlert (the "App") handles your information. Your privacy is a priority, and the App is designed to minimize data collection and maximize user control. The App operates on a local-first principle: all personal data stays on your device.
privacy_p_info: To provide its core functionality (sending emergency alerts via SMS and/or email), the App processes the following information:
privacy_info_li1: {{ ts_li1_5 }} Data: When you trigger an alert, the App accesses your device's GPS coordinates and may resolve them into a physical address. This information is included in the alert message sent to your chosen recipients via a Google Maps link. {{ ts_li1_5 }} is only fetched at the moment of sending and is not tracked continuously.
privacy_info_li2: Recipient {{ nav_contact }} Information: You provide the phone numbers and optionally email addresses of your trusted contacts. These are stored locally on your device.
privacy_info_li3: Alert Messages: You may create and customise predefined alert messages. These are stored locally on your device.
privacy_info_li4: Voice Recordings: The App uses speech-to-text to transcribe voice messages. Audio is processed on-device for transcription and is not stored or transmitted beyond the transcription result, which becomes part of the alert message.
privacy_info_li5: Alert History: The App maintains a local log of alerts sent, including timestamps, recipients, and delivery status. This history is stored on your device only.
privacy_p_perm: The App requests specific system permissions to function. Each permission is requested at runtime with a clear explanation, and you may deny any permission (though some {{ price_features }} will be unavailable).
privacy_and_perm_li1: Fine & Coarse {{ ts_li1_5 }} (ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION, ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION): To determine your geographic coordinates when sending an emergency alert.
privacy_and_perm_li2: Send SMS (SEND_SMS): To send alert messages directly via your device's SIM card {{ ts_loc_li7 }} requiring a third-party service.
privacy_and_perm_li3: Read Phone State (READ_PHONE_STATE): To check SIM card availability and cellular network registration status, ensuring the App can accurately report whether SMS sending is possible.
privacy_and_perm_li4: Record Audio (RECORD_AUDIO): To capture voice input for speech-to-text transcription of alert messages.
privacy_and_perm_li5: Read {{ sms_so_li1_2 }} (READ_CONTACTS): To allow you to select emergency recipients from your existing contacts.
privacy_and_perm_li6: Post {{ sms_and_li2 }} (POST_NOTIFICATIONS): To display notifications about alert delivery status and dead man's switch timer events.
privacy_and_perm_li7: Internet & Network State (INTERNET, ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE, ACCESS_WIFI_STATE): To communicate with the {{ term_twilio }} SMS API (if configured), send email alerts via SMTP, perform address lookups from GPS coordinates, and verify connectivity status.
privacy_and_perm_li8: Wake Lock (WAKE_LOCK): To prevent the device from sleeping during the alert sending process, ensuring delivery completes.
privacy_and_perm_li9: Disable Keyguard (DISABLE_KEYGUARD): To allow alerts triggered from home screen widgets or external automation (e.g., Bluetooth{{ phil_sen_li2 }}s) to proceed {{ ts_loc_li7 }} requiring the device to be unlocked.
privacy_and_perm_li10: Battery Optimisation Exemption (REQUEST_IGNORE_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATIONS): To ensure the dead man's switch timer and widget-triggered alerts work reliably in the background.
privacy_and_perm_li11: Billing (com.android.vending.BILLING): To process in-app purchases for unlocking the unlimited recipients feature via Google Play.
privacy_ios_perm_li1: {{ ts_li1_5 }} (When In Use / Always): To determine your geographic coordinates when sending an emergency alert.
privacy_ios_perm_li2: Microphone: To capture voice input for speech-to-text transcription.
privacy_ios_perm_li3: Speech Recognition: To transcribe recorded voice into text for alert messages.
privacy_ios_perm_li4: {{ sms_so_li1_2 }}: To allow you to select emergency recipients from your existing contacts.
privacy_ios_perm_li5: {{ sms_and_li2 }}: To display delivery status and timer notifications.
privacy_p_methods: The App supports multiple methods for sending alerts:
privacy_method_li1: {{ term_direct_sms }} ({{ android_table_th2 }} only): Messages are sent directly through your device's SIM card and carrier. The App uses the {{ android_table_th2 }} SMS Manager API. Standard carrier messaging rates may apply.
privacy_method_li2: {{ term_twilio }} API (iOS & {{ android_table_th2 }}): If you choose to configure {{ term_twilio }}, the App uses your personal {{ term_twilio }} {{ qa_step3_p4 }} credentials to send SMS via the {{ term_twilio }} REST API. Your credentials are stored locally on your device using encrypted storage (flutter_secure_storage). {{ term_twilio }} processes the message according to {{ term_twilio }}'s {{ footer_privacy }}.
privacy_method_li3: iOS SMS Composer: On iOS, the App may present the native SMS composer interface, which requires manual confirmation before sending.
privacy_method_li4: Email (SMTP): If you configure email redundancy, the App sends alert emails using your SMTP credentials. These credentials are stored locally on your device. The email is transmitted through your configured SMTP provider.
privacy_storage_li1: Local Storage Only: All configuration data, including recipient information, message templates, alert history, and app preferences, is stored locally on your device using SharedPreferences and encrypted storage.
privacy_storage_li2: Sensitive Credentials: {{ term_twilio }} API credentials (Account SID, Auth Token) are stored using flutter_secure_storage, which uses the {{ android_table_th2 }} Keystore system and iOS Keychain for hardware-backed encryption.
privacy_storage_li3: No Cloud Storage: The Developer does not operate any server to collect, store, or monitor your location data, contacts, messages, or usage patterns.
privacy_storage_li4: No Analytics or Tracking: The App does not include any analytics SDKs, crash reporting tools, or advertising frameworks. No usage data is transmitted to the Developer or any third party.
privacy_p_sharing: The App does not sell, trade, or share your personal data with any third parties. Data is only transmitted in the following circumstances, all initiated by your explicit action of pressing the alert {{ phil_sen_li2 }}:
privacy_sharing_li1: To the recipients you explicitly configured when you trigger an alert (via SMS and/or email).
privacy_sharing_li2: To your mobile carrier when sending Direct SMS on {{ android_table_th2 }}.
privacy_sharing_li3: To {{ term_twilio }} when using the {{ term_twilio }} API for SMS delivery (only if you have configured it).
privacy_sharing_li4: To your SMTP email provider when sending email alerts (only if you have configured it).
privacy_sharing_li5: To Google Maps via a URL link included in the alert message (the recipient opens this link; no data is sent to Google by the App itself).
privacy_sharing_li6: To Apple/Google for in-app purchase verification (purchase status only, no personal data).
privacy_p_purchases: The App offers an optional in-app purchase to unlock unlimited recipients. This purchase is processed entirely through the Apple App Store or Google Play Store. The Developer does not receive or store any payment information. Purchase status is cached locally on your device.
privacy_p_widgets: The App provides optional home screen widgets for quick alert access. Widget configuration (custom message) is stored locally via SharedPreferences. Tapping a widget launches the App to send an alert and does not transmit any data independently.
privacy_p_timer: The App includes a countdown timer feature that can automatically send an alert if not dismissed within a configured period. This operates entirely on-device. No data is transmitted until an alert is actually triggered.
privacy_retention_li1: All data is stored locally on your device and persists until you clear the App's data, uninstall the App, or manually delete entries (e.g., alert history, recipients).

er_h2_1: üí° What is the Email Redundancy {{ android_table_th1 }}?
er_p1: {{ qa_step3_p9 }} in TapAlert allows the app to send emergency alerts and reporting messages to your designated contacts via email, in addition to or instead of SMS.
er_p2: The primary purpose of email redundancy is to ensure your message gets delivered even if primary SMS channels fail or are unavailable.
er_li1_1: ‚úÖ Secondary Delivery Path: If you are connected to Wi-Fi but have no cellular service (and Wi-Fi Calling is disabled or unsupported), email acts{{ price_disclaimer3 }}perfect fallback.
er_li1_2: ‚úÖ International Travel: When traveling abroad where SMS might be extremely expensive or unreliable, you can rely purely on Wi-Fi and send alerts via email for free.
er_li1_3: ‚úÖ Additional Peace of Mind: Sending alerts via both SMS and Email simultaneously ensures that if an emergency contact misses a text, they might still see the email notification.

er_p3: An App Password is a randomly generated passcode that gives a third-party app (like TapAlert) permission to access your email {{ qa_step3_p4 }} to send messages on your behalf.
er_h3_1: Why do I need one instead of my real password?
er_p4: Modern email providers block basic password logins to protect your {{ qa_step3_p4 }} from hackers. An App Password bypasses Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) for that specific app {{ ts_loc_li7 }} giving the app your actual {{ qa_step3_p4 }} password. If you ever want to revoke TapAlert's access, you simply delete the App Password in your email settings, and your main {{ qa_step3_p4 }} password remains safe and unchanged.
er_p5: To generate an App Password, almost all email providers require you to have Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) enabled on your {{ qa_step3_p4 }} first.

ugn_s1_p1: On first launch, TapAlert will walk you through a permissions setup screen. Grant the following for full functionality:
ugn_s1_r1c2: Includes your GPS coordinates and address in alerts
ugn_s1_r2c2: Allows voice-to-text for custom alert messages
ugn_s1_r3c2: Lets you pick recipients from your phone's address book
ugn_s1_r4c2: Shows confirmation when an alert is sent
ugn_s1_r5c2: Sends alerts directly from your SIM card
ugn_s1_r6c2: Detects cellular availability for smart fallback
ugn_s1_p2: You can grant or skip any permission during setup and adjust them later in your device's system settings.
ugn_s2_p1: The home screen has three pages you can navigate by swiping left or right:
ugn_s2_r2c3: Large SOS and I'm OK buttons ‚Äî the default
ugn_s2_p2: The app always opens on Panic Mode (center page).
ugn_s3_p1: The central page is designed for maximum simplicity ‚Äî ideal for emergencies and senior users.
ugn_s3_li1: SOS button ‚Äî sends an "SOS, I need help" alert with your location.
ugn_s3_li2: I'm OK button ‚Äî sends a reassuring "I'm OK" status to all contacts.
ugn_s3_li3: Voice buttons ‚Äî tap the microphone icon next to SOS or I'm OK to record a voice message. Your speech is transcribed to text and included in the alert.
ugn_s3_li4: Emergency Call button ‚Äî dials your local emergency number (e.g., 112, 911) immediately, based on your country setting.
ugn_s4_p1: Swipe left from Panic Mode to access Situation Alerts Mode. This page shows a list of 3 pre-configured alert buttons.
ugn_s4_p2: You can edit the situation alert text using the edit button on the bottom of the screen and then selecting the message to be edited.
ugn_s4_p3: The messages are sent tapping the corresponding button.
ugn_s4_p4: If you want to add a voice message to the button text you can use the microphone button besides it corresponding alert.
ugn_s5_p1: Tap the people icon in the top toolbar to open the Recipients screen.
ugn_s5_li1: Add manually ‚Äî tap Add and enter a phone number in international format (e.g., +31600000000).
ugn_s5_li2: Add from Contacts ‚Äî tap the contacts icon to pick directly from your phone's address book.
ugn_s5_li3: Add email ‚Äî optionally add an email address to each recipient for email redundancy.
ugn_s5_li4: Remove ‚Äî swipe or tap the delete icon next to any contact.
ugn_s5_note1: Free tier: up to 1 recipient. Premium: up to 50 recipients.
ugn_s5_note2: iOS tip: If you only see a few contacts, go to Settings > Privacy > Contacts > TapAlert and select All Contacts.
ugn_s6_li1: Open the app (or tap your home screen widget).
ugn_s6_li2: Tap the alert button (SOS, I'm OK, or a Standard Mode slot).
ugn_s6_li3: If a countdown is configured, a dialog appears giving you time to cancel.
ugn_s6_li4: The app fetches your current GPS location and builds the message.
ugn_s6_li5: The alert sound plays while sending.
ugn_s6_li6: A status report is shown with per-recipient success or failure details.
ugn_s6_li9: A Google Maps link to your current location
ugn_s7_p1: Before sending, TapAlert shows a countdown to prevent accidental alerts.
ugn_s7_li1: Default duration: 10 seconds. Adjustable from 0 (immediate) to 30 seconds in Settings > Countdown Duration.
ugn_s7_li2: Cancel: Tap CANCEL any time during the countdown to abort.
ugn_s7_li3: Send immediately: Tap SEND NOW to skip the remaining delay.
ugn_s8_p1: The Check-in Timer is a dead man's switch: if you don't cancel it in time, TapAlert automatically sends an alert. Useful for hiking, traveling alone, or any situation where you want someone notified if you stop responding.
ugn_s8_start_li1: Swipe left to the Check-in Timer page.
ugn_s8_start_li2: Use the wheel pickers to set a duration (hours and minutes).
ugn_s8_run_li1: The timer counts down on screen.
ugn_s8_run_li2: When less than 5 minutes remain, TapAlert plays a warning sound and shows a dialog:
ugn_s8_run_li2a: Cancel ‚Äî dismiss the warning and let the timer continue.
ugn_s8_run_li2b: Stop ‚Äî abort the timer (no alert will be sent).
ugn_s8_run_li2c: Restart ‚Äî reset the timer to the original duration.
ugn_s8_run_li3: If the timer reaches zero without being stopped or reset, the alert is sent automatically.
ugn_s8_note1: Android: The timer runs as a foreground service and remains active when the app is in the background or the screen is off.
ugn_s8_note2: iOS: The timer may not fire if the app is force-closed. Keep the app running in the background.

ugn_s9_li2: Tap any entry for per-recipient success/failure details and error information.
ugn_s9_li3: Free tier: stores the last 20 alerts. Premium: stores up to 200.
ugn_s9_li4: Delete individual entries or clear all history from the trash icon.
ugn_s10_p1: Tap the gear icon to open Settings.

ugn_s10_sms_li2: Twilio ‚Äî sends via the Twilio API over internet (Wi-Fi or data). Used as automatic fallback if Direct SMS fails.

ugn_s10_email_p1: Configure SMTP email to send alerts via email in addition to SMS. Useful when SMS is unavailable but Wi-Fi is connected.
ugn_s10_email_li3: Select a preset provider (Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo, iCloud) or enter custom SMTP details.
ugn_s10_email_li4: Enter your email address and an App Password (recommended over your main password).

ugn_s10_trigger_li1: Tap to Send ‚Äî a single tap starts the countdown.
ugn_s10_trigger_li2: Press and Hold (5s) ‚Äî you must hold the button for 5 seconds. Recommended to prevent accidental sends.
ugn_s10_countdown_p1: Set the delay before the alert sends (0‚Äì30 seconds). A longer countdown gives you more time to cancel if triggered by mistake.

ugn_s10_sound_li3: Sound Pitch ‚Äî Low, Standard, or High.

ugn_s10_other_li6: Home Country ‚Äî ensures local phone numbers are formatted correctly.
ugn_s10_other_li7: App Language ‚Äî override the interface language (default: device language).
ugn_s10_other_li8: App Theme ‚Äî Light, Dark, or System Default.
